Job Description:
First Orion is seeking a talented Data Scientist to join a leading mobile software vendor in the Data Solutions Group. Individuals in this role will use their intense curiosity and data mining skills to dive into large data sets. They will be asked to use their discoveries to build and shape the products and solutions that will be the foundation for First Orion's success in the future.
What you'll be doing:
Model development – building predictive and heuristic models using statistical and machine learning methodologies
Data discovery – identifying new data sources/features and novel applications of existing data
Data quality analysis – creating and monitoring quality control processes for model input and output
Scala/Jupyter/Spark – using Apache Spark to tackle distributed programming in Scala and Python.
ETL – accessing and utilizing various data sources and FO databases
What you'll need:
Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Data Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Economics, or related field of study
2 years working experience in Data Science
Advanced programming experience in language of your choice (Scala/Python/R preferred)
Experience with SQL
Strong problem-solving and data exploration skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
High curiosity for data discovery
Ability to implement verbal and visual storytelling with data
Bonus Points:
M.S. in STEM discipline
Prior experience in the telecommunications industry
Prior experience with anomaly detection
Amazon Web Services experience
Spark experience
Knowledge about big data platforms
Company Benefits:
Balancing the work-life flow is key to health and happiness! That is why we offer one of the most competitive packages in our industry with open PTO, company paid holidays, Flex Fridays and flexible work arrangements. We strongly value the health and wellness of our teammates and through our state-of-the-art fitness center, full-time personal trainer on staff, and fitness classes (both in person and remote), we’re helping our teammates reach their wellness goals while at work. Add on generous health and dental/vision options, retirement plans, learning and development programs, career path frameworks, tuition reimbursement, company options and bonus potential you have many ways to take advantage of a comprehensive benefits package that means the most to you!

Learn More About First Orion:
First Orion helps businesses generate more revenue, increase efficiency, and improve the customer experience by empowering them to brand their phone calls with their name, logo and reason for calling. We are the market leader in branded communications technology, and a trusted partner to Fortune 500 companies and the largest U.S. mobile carriers.

Fremont, California
Type: Full-time
Min. Experience: Some Experience
Salary: $80,000 - $90,000

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will help support the Senior Data Scientist in analysis and research, and machine learning modeling that is underpinning new and current products. Additionally, the Junior Data Scientist will support the Data Engineer in building new data pipelines including new ETL functions.
Essential Duties/Responsibilities

Data Analysis
Data Cleaning and Preprocessing
Model Development and Feature Engineering Research
Data Visualization
Documentation

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in STEM field using applied statistics and/or machine learning with two plus years of experience.
Strong statistical and mathematical skills: You should have a strong understanding of statistical concepts such as probability theory, hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and machine learning algorithms.
Proficiency in programming languages: You should be proficient in at least one programming language, such as Python or R. You should also be familiar with SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Data manipulation and visualization: You should be able to clean, manipulate, and transform data using tools like pandas and numpy in Python or tidyverse in R. You should also be able to create effective data visualizations using libraries such as Matplotlib or ggplot2.
Familiarity with machine learning algorithms: You should have a basic understanding of machine learning algorithms such as linear regression, logistic regression, decision trees, and clustering techniques.
Communication skills: You should have excellent communication skills, including the ability to clearly explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Collaboration skills: The ability to work collaboratively with other team members, including data engineers, data analysts, and business stakeholders, can be beneficial for you in delivering successful projects.
Problem-solving skills: You should be able to identify and solve complex problems, often with incomplete or imperfect data.
Attention to detail: You should have excellent attention to detail, ensuring that your data analysis is accurate and error-free.
Continuous learning: You should be willing to learn new skills and keep up with the latest industry trends and developments.

Nice-to-have skills and Experience

Experience with AGILE/SCRUM/JIRA.
Experience with the AWS cloud platform.
Understanding of deep learning algorithms.
Domain expertise: Having domain expertise in criminal justice, crime analysis and/or risk calculation.
Knowledge of data ethics and privacy.
Project management skills – scoping, planning, and executing

Location: Fremont, CA

Bamboo Health is a leader in cloud-based care coordination software and analytics solutions focused on patients with complex needs, including those suffering from physical health and mental health issues and substance use disorders. We are driven by our mission of enabling better care for patients across the continuum. Our software solutions help healthcare professionals collaborate on shared patients across the spectrum of care. Join us in improving healthcare for all!
Summary:
The Data Scientist will live and breathe data and be excited about building user-facing data products. They will work with the Product Development team, Health Data Science team, other internal stakeholders, and external stakeholders to develop data-driven solutions powered by our unique data pipeline. The Data Scientist will excel at creative problem solving, cross-team collaboration, and thinking independently about how to utilize data to address the challenges our customers face.

What You'll Do:
Data Analysis: Perform thorough data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can guide business strategies and product development.
Model Development: Design, develop and implement machine learning models and algorithms that enable predictive and prescriptive analytics to solve complex business challenges.
Feature Engineering: Identify relevant features and preprocess data to optimize model performance and accuracy.
Experimentation: Devise and conduct experiments to test hypotheses, refine models, and enhance the performance of AI algorithms.
Data Visualization: Create clear and compelling data visualizations and reports to effectively communicate findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Collaboration: Work closely with software engineers, product managers, domain experts, and other scientists to integrate data-driven insights into the product development lifecycle.
Continuous Learning: Stay up to date on industry trends and advancements in data science and healthcare.
Data Integrity: Ensure data quality, integrity, and consistency throughout all stages of data collection, processing, and analysis.

What Success Looks Like:
In 3 months:
Become familiar with our data infrastructure, ETL processes, and data models.
Complete onboarding and training programs.
Work collaboratively with the data and product teams to understand our data-driven approach to product development.

In 6 months:
Build predictive models to inform product development.
Develop and implement data-driven strategies to support business growth.
Conduct statistical analyses to validate and interpret results.

In 12 months:
Develop innovative data-driven solutions to improve healthcare outcomes.
Provide thought leadership on data science techniques and methodologies.
Contribute to the growth and development of our data team.

What You Need:
Bachelor's degree in data science, computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related field.
3-5 years of related experience
Experience in developing predictive and machine learning models
Proficiency in Python and SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work independently.
Self‐motivated and able to adapt and thrive in a fast paced, dynamic environment
Ability to travel periodically for work.
A work environment that is conducive to high quality virtual interactions. This includes but is not limited to being able to work from a quiet space with minimal interruptions or distractions, and a strong internet connection.

Special Consideration Given to:
Experience with supervised and unsupervised anomaly/outlier detection models.
Experience with time-series models (e.g., simple models, average and smoothing models, linear regression models, ARIMA models).
A proficient understanding of basic machine learning model performance metrics (e.g., accuracy, precision, recall, F1, Matthew’s correlation coefficient, ROC/AUC and theory (e.g., variance-bias tradeoff)).
An understanding of the pharmaceutical supply chain.
An understanding of the pillars of and practices of FairAI.

What You Get:
Join one of the most innovative healthcare technology companies in the country.
Have the autonomy to build something with an enthusiastically supportive team.
Learn from working at the highest levels and on the most strategic priorities of the company, including from world class investors and advisors.
Receive competitive compensation, including equity, with health, dental, vision and other benefits.

Bamboo Health is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and affirmative action employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

At Gentherm, we say, “It’s about the person.” We’re with you on a cold winter day when you turn on your heated seat and steering wheel or helping manage patient body temperature in the operating room, recovering room or intensive care units. We take a human approach with everything we do.

As the global market leader of innovative thermal management and pneumatic comfort technologies for the automotive industry we embrace the opportunity to create and deliver extraordinary solutions that make meaningful differences in everyday life. We do this by improving health, wellness, comfort and energy efficiency.

We embrace an entrepreneurial spirit and combine that with our global leadership to deliver results. Working at Gentherm provides you the opportunity to not only shape the future of the automotive and medical industries, but also influence your career throughout the company. You will be engaged, challenged and inspired by our team to deliver leading thermal technologies that positively impact lives around the world.
Junior Data Scientist

IMPACT and OPPORTUNITY

At Gentherm, we are expanding our human research testing capabilities and are looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our new thermal physiology research team. The team sits at the forefront of the company’s mission in developing thermal solutions that improve health, wellness and comfort. The Junior Data Scientist will play an integral role in supporting our data infrastructure and analyzing the influx of quantitative and qualitative data from the thermophysiology research team. This includes human physiological and perceptual data from laboratory-based and real-world driving studies and automotive data from vehicles and our thermal solutions. The Junior Data Scientist will assist in the development of individual-specific mathematical models and artificial intelligence (AI) algorithms for predicting personalized comfort and wellness. Whilst the candidate should be grounded in fundamental principles of data science methods, they should also know how to rise above the numbers and explain essential insights to users at all levels. Application of data is at the heart of our mission
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Support data collection, archival and curation for integration into databases with high data quality, transparency, validity and reliability (i.e. data management plan)
Explore various analytic techniques such as signal processing, statistics, machine/deep learning, and optimization to extract insights from laboratory-based and real-world data
Support in developing appropriate human thermal comfort models captured from various data sources; thermal images, wearables, vehicle-level data
Support data collection, archival and curation for integration into databases with high data quality, transparency, validity and reliability (i.e. data management plan)
Support our research team in writing technical reports backed by statistical analysis.
Ensure compliance with data protection policies (e.g. HIPAA).
Communicate data using appropriate data visualization tools
Participates in miscellaneous research efforts within the Gentherm R&D team.
QUALIFICATIONS

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Master’s in Data Science, Computer Science, Biostatistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Concrete knowledge of a variety of data science methods, and machine learning algorithms
Experience with statistical software packages and/or machine learning libraries and programming languages (Power BI, MS Excel, SQL, Python, R etc.)
Appreciation for data visualization methods and ability to interpret data analysis results.
Ability to automate experimental data acquisition and analysis.
Excellent communication skills.
Creative problem-solving skills

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience in physiology, psychology, or ergonomics
Experience with cloud computing (preferably Azure), specifically data storage, data preprocessing, feature engineering, data transformation, and model training on Azure storage accounts, Azure data factory, and Azure machine learning studio.
COMPETENCIES

Deliver Results
Understand the mission and output of your team; set SMART objectives and deliver
Drive Change
Focus on agility and commitment to continuous improvement; Understand and act on internal and external drivers of change
Build Capability
Foster a culture of learning and development; Support individual growth through continuous feedback to achieve personal and professional goals
Cultivate Innovation
Openly embrace, create, implement and support new and innovative ideas, processes and technology that deliver business results
PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORK ENVIRONMENT

All positions in our office require interaction with people and technology while either standing or sitting. In order to best serve our customers, internal and external, all associates must be able to communicate face-to-face and on the phone with or without reasonable accommodation. Gentherm is committed to compliance with its obligations under all applicable state and federal laws prohibiting employment discrimination. In keeping with this commitment, it attempts to reasonably accommodate applicants and employees in accordance with the requirements of the disability discrimination laws. It also invites individuals with disabilities to participate in a good faith, interactive process to identify reasonable accommodations that can be made without imposing an undue hardship.

Gentherm is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

Posit (formerly RStudio) creates great software that helps people understand data and make better decisions in real-world applications. Our core offering is an open source data science platform, and we aim to make it available to everyone, regardless of their economic means.
Posit is looking for a Data Scientist to join the Center of Excellence team to help deliver data-driven business decision making and deliver exceptional experiences to customers. This is a unique opportunity to grow the data science foundation working for a company that’s all about Data Science. You will work with Posit’s open-source and professional tools to transform raw data, build analyses and models, optimize campaigns and sales efforts, all the way up to designing and deploying executive and board dashboards. This is a critical role in helping Posit learn more about our business so that we can do a better job delivering on our mission.
What you’ll own:
Lead end-to-end data projects include data collection and transformation, generating insights, determining recommendations creating a positive impact, and verbal/written communication to stakeholders.
Own the creation, deployment, and iteration of code-based descriptive and predictive models of customer behavior tailored to specific business needs.
Develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards and reports for stakeholders using tools such as Shiny and Quarto to communicate the health of different aspects of the business.
Identify and troubleshoot data errors and discrepancies from various sources.
Drive strategic projects that align with the overall vision and long-term goals of the company.
What you’ll assist with:
Work closely with executive leadership on setting long term goals with clear deliverables and making action plans to realize them.
Collaborate on initiatives to optimize data processes, models, and reporting across the organization.
What you’ll teach:
Educate non-technical stakeholders on interpretation of insights from data, ensuring a shared understanding of key metrics and insights.
Share knowledge on industry best practices, tools, and methodologies with team members and stakeholders.
Mentor other team members fostering a culture of continuous learning and collaboration.
What you’ll learn:
Gain in-depth knowledge of the Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, and Finance landscapes, along with the specific needs and challenges of our organization.
Continued development of your data science toolset with exposure to tools and analytical techniques tailored for our business environment.
Learn to align analytical approaches with strategic business objectives, contributing to data-driven decision making throughout the company.
Work alongside talented professionals and business executives across diverse functions, learning from their expertise and contributing your own.
About You:
You are humble, kind, curious, and people smart
3+ years of direct experience in a data science role, ideally working in a growth SaaS company with hands-on experience specific to sales, marketing, and finance data
Hands-on experience developing, debugging, and improving models in R or Python
You are comfortable with version control and prioritize its usage across various projects
You are highly organized, self-motivated and able to adapt to changing priorities, with strong critical thinking and project management skills
You enjoy working with cross-functional teams, and understand trade-offs in goals and investments of resources
Willingness and desire to work in a fast-paced and high growth environment
You are able to communicate complex ideas in a straightforward, engaging and informative way, that demonstrates empathy for customer struggles and challenges
You are able to use code to create meaningful reports and dashboards from messy data sources
Proficient in using R or Python for data wrangling, visualization, modeling, and communicating information with stakeholders
Within 1 month:
Familiarize yourself with the core functions of Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, and Finance teams, as well as our products, markets, and customers.
Learn about our data environment including key sources of data and business context of how data is collected, stored, and used for decision making.
Start conducting exploratory data analysis on relevant datasets to gain insights into business trends.
Develop relationships and gain familiarity with cross-functional teams, including attending meetings to understand the data needs and critical challenges of various departments.
Within 3 months:
Implement robust data collection and cleaning procedures to ensure data quality and accessibility.
Build initial analyses and models to assist key business functions including Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, and Finance.
Develop interactive dashboards and reports for key stakeholders using visualization tools.
Continue working closely with the supported departments to refine and align on priorities and OKRs.
Within 6 months:
Deploy and iterate on the models developed, ensuring alignment with business goals and incorporating feedback.
Initiate more advanced analytical projects tailored to drive success in key business functions.
Regularly engage with stakeholders to review findings, gather feedback, and provide recommendations.
Within 12 months:
Drive strategic projects that have a substantial impact on business objectives.
Mentor team members and lead project teams.
Identify and lead initiatives to optimize data processes, models, and reporting.
Grow the level of influence of data science in the organization by scaling models across different markets or segments, translating successes from one area to broader company applications.
Working at Posit:
We welcome all talented colleagues and are committed to a culture that represents diversity in all its forms.
We prioritize giving ourselves “focus time” to get deep work done. We minimize meetings and attempt to operate asynchronously.
We are a learning organization and take mentorship and career growth seriously. We hope to learn from you and we anticipate that you will also deepen your skills, influence, and leadership as a result of working at Posit.
We operate under a unique sustainable business model: We have over 50% of our engineering dedicated to creating free and open source software. We are profitable and we plan to be around decades from now.
Posit is a Public Benefit Corporation (PBC) and a Certified B Corporation®, which means our open-source mission is codified into our charter. As a result, our corporate decisions balance the community's interests, customers, employees, and shareholders. Hear more about why we think this matters here.
Notable:
We offer competitive compensation with extensive human-first, people-focused benefits to prioritize your personal and financial well-being.
100% of medical, dental, and vision insurance premiums are covered for employees and their families! Fertility and gender-affirming healthcare is included in all of our plans.
Supplemental mental health and wellness benefits are available via Ginger even if you don’t opt in to our insurance plans, including Ginger for teen family members.
Posit's gender-neutral paid parental leave policy covers all new parents, including foster and adoptive parents.
All full-time employees are eligible for 401k enrollment starting on day one.
After six months of employment, Posit provides a substantial yearly match to employee 401K contributions.
An annual profit-sharing bonus for employees recognizes our team’s contributions to company performance across the year.
We are a 100% distributed team. You are also welcome to come into our Boston office.
We offer a $400 monthly reimbursement for coworking space rental if you prefer to work away from home.
Our Lifestyle Savings Account offers an initial deposit of $1800 and then an additional quarterly stipend of $375 to cover the costs of professional development, wellness, financial health, charitable giving, and remote work support.
We provide a flexible environment with a generous vacation policy that encourages a minimum of four weeks PTO per year plus 13 paid company holidays.
Are you excited about this role but not sure if your experience aligns with every qualification in the job description? That’s okay. We know multiple perspectives are essential for a thriving organization and we'd still love to hear from you!
Posit is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage applicants of different backgrounds, cultures, genders, experiences, abilities, and perspectives to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical disability, or length of time spent unemployed.

Wiliot was founded by the team that invented one of the technologies at the heart of 5G. Their next vision was to develop an IoT sticker, a computing element that can power itself by harvesting radio frequency energy, bringing connectivity and intelligence to everyday products and packaging, things previously disconnect from the IoT. This revolutionary mixture of cloud and semiconductor technology is being used by some of the world’s largest consumer, retail, food and pharmaceutical companies to change the way we make, distribute, sell, use and recycle products.
Our investors include Softbank, Amazon, Alibaba, Verizon, NTT DoCoMo, Qualcomm and PepsiCo.
We are looking for a data scientist with proven hands-on skills to join the team and build high-performing, scalable applications that turn time-series telemetry into data products. You will collaborate with great people from multiple disciplines to create innovative digital products and integrate them within the Sensing-as-a-Service cloud platform.

Requirements:
BSc in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering or equivalent. Higher degree is an advantage.
At least 3 years of development experience – Python, Scala is an advantage
Experience with cloud data environments and big data ETL procedures, cloud architecture (AWS/GCP/Azure)
Experience with AI/ML/DL methods
Familiarity with some ML/data-processing frameworks and libraries (TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, MXNet, Spark, Scikit-learn, Pandas)
High self-learning and independent working abilities
Strong spoken and written English
Strong interpersonal and communication skills

Rapidly experiment and build models to clean signals and provide valuable insights to our customers.
Design algorithms and SW solutions, considering large scale, high availability, security, robustness, performance, and cloud aspects.
Work hands-on with the data using SQL, PySpark, and other tools to extract, analyze, and visualize data.
Understand and oversee all phases of the development life cycle, such as Automation, CI\CD, TDD, Integrations, Builds, and Deployment.
Work with cross-functional stakeholders such as product management, marketing, and SW engineering.

Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet
Dun & Bradstreet unlocks the power of data through analytics, creating a better tomorrow. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture and accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our 6,000+ global team members are passionate about what we do. We are dedicated to helping clients turn uncertainty into confidence, risk into opportunity and potential into prosperity. Bold and diverse thinkers are always welcome. Come join us!

Role: Data Scientist, Risk Analytics

The Data Scientist, Risk Analytics will create innovative approaches to statistical data modeling and analytics by using Natural Language Processing on unstructured/alternative data sources to enhance the business failure risk as well as business fraudulent risk.
Support the development of new proof-of-concepts for D&B’s risk analytics products in our Analytics Studio (a cloud-based analytics platform where clients can test the new products).
Work with internal / external D&B clients and stakeholders to identify their business needs and opportunities, to develop, implement, and manage solutions, and to improve business results.
Establish and maintain strong relationships with key business stakeholders.
Participate in all aspects of a modeling engagement, including design, development, validation, calibration, documentation, approval, implementation, monitoring, and reporting.
Research complex business issues and recommend solutions, including model inputs and end products.
Serve as a Subject Matter Expert on predictive models within the Advanced Analytic Services team and with business users; consult with the business, as appropriate, on predictive modeling solutions.
Validate the performance of existing quantitative risk models, to ensure that key KPIs are set and attained, and to recommend changes when necessary.
Develop a solid working knowledge of how current systems and data sources are used in existing predictive modeling projects; and drive timely retrieval of risk analytics data from existing systems to create algorithms that meet business needs.
Manage multiple assignments, many of which with challenging timelines, both working independently and collaborating effectively in a team environment.
Partner with internal D&B team to develop new business solutions in risk analytics.
Requirements:
Master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or a related quantitative field (U.S. or foreign degree equivalent) plus three (3) years of experience in advanced statistical and data analytics or a related role.
Prior experience must also include three (3) years of experience in/with: PySpark, Python and SQL for Big Data Mining and building innovative predictive algorithms; Web/Cloud Analytics; AWS and Azure cloud based platforms, specifically using various UI/editors to write code and/or implement Machine Learning Models within these platforms; experience with building Credit Risk Models in Python and/or PySpark; commercial finance data; and communicating complex ideas to both a technical and non-technical audience.
Prior experience must include one (1) year of experience in/with Natural Language Processing and parsing textual datasets.
May work from home from any location in the U.S. or from any Dun & Bradstreet office in the U.S.

At Fulcrum, we provide cutting-edge data science consulting and software solutions to help companies solve challenging business problems. Through the utilization of our innovative products and dedicated team, clients are able to operate more efficiently, manage risk, and make informed business decisions every day. Fulcrum Analytics has stood at the forefront of data, analytics, and innovative software for over 25 years, offering sophisticated solutions, groundbreaking technologies, and winning strategies that help companies achieve their targeted results.
Role Description:
The Data Scientist role is expected to develop analytical, statistical, and machine learning solutions to client business problems. The Data Scientist will have a number of responsibilities, including:
Extract and manipulate data from various sources (databases, files, APIs, etc.); requires knowledge of how to deal with the inherent structure of the data.
Use Python (and R) to perform statistical analysis, profiling, reporting, and modeling.
Develop and interpret multivariate statistical models, such as linear or logistic regression, survival analysis, and other parametric or non-parametric models that predict business metrics.
Build machine learning pipelines to aid with decision-making and streamline critical business processes.
Apply data science principles to solve complex business problems, including but not limited to problem framing, evaluating the impact of business interventions, identifying performance drivers, conducting diagnostic analyses, and generating insights.
Interpret statistical findings in the context of clients’ businesses, and create presentations that communicate analytical results to non-technical client audiences.
Interact with clients to establish requirements, organize meetings, and deliver presentations.
Research practical data science topics and prepare presentations to share findings and knowledge with team members.
Qualifications:
1-3 years of data science work experience
Experience ingesting, cleaning, and manipulating data
Data mining and statistical programming experience with Python and SQL
Experience working with large datasets, text data, and complex relational data models
Strong understanding of various statistical methods, such as linear and logistic regression, time series, design of experiments, etc.
Exceptional oral and written communication skills
Ability to multitask on different projects and manage deadlines
Flexibility to work both collaboratively and independently
Bachelors or above in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Math, Econometrics, Business, or related field
Previous consulting experience a strong plus
Marketing analytics experience (segmentation, A/B testing, attribution modeling, marketing mix modeling, propensity modeling, etc.) a plus
Experience with NLP and text analytics a plus
Position Type: Full-time salaried
Reports to: VP of Data Science
Base Compensation: $100,000 - $130,000
Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k with Match, Bonus, Unlimited PTO
Location: Remote within the United States of America; Eastern time zone preferred
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $100,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year

Excellent communication skills to work with various product analyst/business users to understand data needs Provide advanced analysis and ad hoc operational data quality and data literacy reports as requested by stakeholders, business partners, and leadership.

Ability to prioritize and manage concurrent projects, demonstrate initiative, and work independently with minimal supervision
Present data formally and informally and facilitate discussion regarding data outputs
Create documentation for work products and manage or meet target dates.

Job Title: Data Scientist
Location: Palo Alto, CA

Purpose and Objective:
SuccessFactors, Inc. seeks a Data Scientist at our Palo Alto, CA location to collaborate with Product Management, Operations, and Development teams to define and implement data strategies to create insight into how customers implement and use SAP products.

Expectations and Tasks:
Retrieve, manipulate, and analyze data from various sources to draw relevant and actionable conclusions. Contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of KPIs, recurring reports and dashboards to ensure high-level visibility of company performance and planning. Ensure data accuracy by validating data, identify any missing data, and work with engineering to start capturing the right data for analysis. Support internal teams (Finance, Sales, Product, Engineering, Operations, Marketing and Customer Success) with data-driven analysis to drive key business initiatives and decisions. Contribute to data definitions, data storage infrastructure for data mining purposes, and data mining architectures. Utilize skills to resolve data mining performance issues, monitor data mining system performance, and implement efficiency improvements.

Education and Qualifications/Skills and Competencies:
Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Science, or related field and one (1) year of experience in the job offered or a related occupation. The company will also accept a Master’s degree or foreign equivalent in Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.

Work Experience:
Position requires experience, academic coursework, or internship in each of the following:
Acquire and manipulate data using SQL, R, Python or Excel for data wrangling, data cleaning, sourcing from applications relational databases, and Splunk;
Create data visualizations using Excel, Tableau or Power BI;
Transform vague business problems into data-driven questions and identify and retrieve the relevant data set using multiple data source;
Take data as input and output actionable recommendations;
Prepare presentations, forecasts, trends and actionable insights to executive, business and technical teams using Microsoft PowerPoint or similar products;
Collaborate with engineers to define software products; and
Utilize enterprise software including HCM applications and business applications, including CRM, ERP, or financial systems.

Telecommuting permitted.

onsemi (Nasdaq: ON) is driving disruptive innovations to help build a better future. With a focus on automotive and industrial end-markets, the company is accelerating change in megatrends such as vehicle electrification and safety, sustainable energy grids, industrial automation, and 5G and cloud infrastructure. With a highly differentiated and innovative product portfolio, onsemi creates intelligent power and sensing technologies that solve the world’s most complex challenges and leads the way in creating a safer, cleaner, and smarter world.
We are looking for a Data Scientist to help grow onsemi’s Advanced Analytics capabilities. This is an opportunity to impact a growing, $8B+ enterprise that recognizes the need to leverage modern data technologies and methods to help solve critical business problems. You will join a team responsible for advanced analytics and data science across all business functions in the company including Sales, Marketing, Pricing, Supply Chain, Manufacturing and Product Lines.
You will work with other Data Scientists and Analysts through all phases of the Data Science life cycle: problem definition, exploratory analysis, model creation, validation, deployment, monitoring and performance measurement.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Execute all aspects of the Data Science process using Python and various services available in Microsoft Azure (Azure ML, Databricks) and Snowflake:
o Query and clean datasets
o Explore datasets and make observations
o Feature engineering, model selection
o Model tuning, model validation
o Deployment using cloud services
o Monitoring performance and drift
Improve risk analysis simulations using existing predictive models and Monte Carlo simulations.
Build dashboards in Tableau to help Data Scientists and Analysts solve problems in their areas.

Qualifications

Completed a degree in data science, business analytics, engineering, artificial intelligence, information systems, applied/traditional statistics, mathematics, computer science, computer engineering, information technology, or a related field.
Proven experience (3+ years) as a Data Scientist preferably in business operations areas like Sales, Marketing, Pricing, Supply Chain or Manufacturing.
Experience with data frames, pandas and data cleansing in Python or similar languages.
Experience with SQL queries to retrieve data from relational databases.
Experience with software development practices like unit tests, Git, CICD.
Familiarity with modeling techniques like logistic regression, decision trees, time-series forecasting, deep-learning, and computer vision.
Familiarity with probability distributions and risk analysis simulation techniques like Monte Carlo.
Familiarity with Language Models (LLMs), prompt engineering, search indexes and chatbots.

The Data Scientist - Data Analytics is responsible for generating insights and to augment decision making by the business. At Costco, we are on a mission to significantly leverage big data to provide better security products and services for our practitioners. This role is focused on advanced analytics, machine learning and data science delivery to support multiple InfoSec areas. This role will partner with Security Operations and other data owners to build, test advanced analytics solutions and turn data into actionable insights. The Data Scientist is a knowledgeable leader with an ability to lead and is passionate about data and using machine learning to solve security problems. The right candidate will have deep knowledge of applying data science for forecasting, customer analysis, item and inventory management and other areas of retail.
We are looking for a highly motivated, customer focused professional who wants to work in a fun and highly collaborative environment and willing to be the player as well as coach for the data science community at Costco.
This position will be filled onsite in Issaquah, WA or Dallas, TX.
Job Duties/Essential Functions
Designs the analytics methodology to solve business problems.
Conducts end-to-end analysis, including data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables, and presentations.
Processes, cleanses, and verifies the integrity of data used for analysis.
Enriches enterprise data with external sources of information when needed.
Mines and analyzes data from enterprise databases by applying statistics, machine learning and analytic approaches to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques, business strategies etc.
Uses predictive modeling to increase and optimize supply chain, customer experiences, loyalty programs and other business outcomes.
Selects features, and builds and optimizes classifiers using machine learning techniques.
Assesses the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Enhances data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems.
Develops company testing framework and test model quality.
Coordinates with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
Develops processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.
Creates automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance.
Conducts ad-hoc analysis and presents results in an articulated manner.
Works with stakeholders throughout the organization to understand their requests/business problems and to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
Develops comprehensive knowledge of data structures and metrics, and advocates for changes where needed for product development.
Leads the analysis by applying statistics, machine learning and analytic approaches to predict and optimize business outcomes.
Designs and builds ML/DL models to solve business problems.
Frames a problem correctly and comes up with a hypothesis.
Assesses the effectiveness and accuracy of models on an ongoing basis.
Identifies new data that could enhance the quality and accuracy of models to improve predictions.
Communicates results effectively with storytelling and visualization.
Coaches the team in feature engineering using machine learning techniques.
Performs peer review for another Data Scientist’s work.
Provides feedback to enhance the testing framework and MLOps.
Extends beyond core data science work to perform data wrangling and data preparation as needed.
Regular and reliable workplace attendance at your assigned location.
Ability to operate vehicles, equipment or machinery.
Computer, phone, printer, copier, fax


Non-Essential Functions
Assists in other areas of the department as necessary.
Assists in other areas of the company as necessary.
Ability to operate vehicles, equipment or machinery.
Same as Essential Functions

Experience, Skills, Education & Licenses/Certifications
Required:
5+ years’ experience in delivering business insights using advanced statistical and machine learning models and visualization.
Proficiency in working with diverse databases and other data sources.
Strong proficiency in Machine Learning, Statistical and Reporting tools (Python, R, SQL, PowerBI).
Knowledge of Deep Learning and Neural Networks, and its applications.
Strong experience working in Cloud (AWS, Azure) based analytics platform.
Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business including nights, weekends, and holidays.
Recommended:
Graduate degree in Computer Science, Data Science, and Statistics/Mathematics or related field.
Knowledge of Agile software development.
Experience in software development.
Exposure to the retail industry.
Experience leading team of data scientists.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Successful internal candidates will have spent one year or more on their current team.

Management will review the Job Analysis for this position prior to a job offer.

Position Purpose:
The successful candidate will be based in our Austin, TX facility and will support numerous research & development and test & evaluation projects related to defense, forensics, and national security. The candidate will be based in our Austin, TX headquarters within the Quality Assurance & Data Science Business Area. The candidate must be motivated to contribute in a team environment, collaborate across multiple scientific and technical disciplines, and be excited to develop new skills. The candidate must have the flexibility to balance multiple on-going tasks while operating efficiently with minimal supervision. As needed, the candidate should be able to direct others to accomplish project tasks. The candidate must be detail oriented and be able to appropriately document their work. Job functions will include performing data analytics and statistical analyses, training and optimizing machine learning and predictive models, generating visualizations, and developing automated data processing pipelines on chemical, biological, radio frequency (RF), visual (imagery), and text-based data.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Performs data analytics, specifically data clean-up, data processing, machine learning modeling, statistical analysis, multivariate data analysis, and/or data visualization, as related to scientific data.
Applies technical skills to plan and execute assigned project work including development of data pre-processing routines, data summarizations, data visualizations and plotting, development and application of machine learning and artificial intelligence models, development of detection algorithms, and development and deployment automated processing pipelines.
Maintains operational capabilities of computational assets as needed by project requirements.
Leads meetings with company clients by preparing and presenting materials in meetings.
Appropriately annotates developed computer code/scripts with comments and through user guides/manuals.
Performs maintenance and updates of scripts/code for routine data analysis.
Presents technical results through the drafting of technical reports and presentation materials.
Presents experimental results and recommended actions at internal project meetings.
Supports business development efforts as needed by drafting technical sections of proposals, providing proposal review, assessing levels of effort required to complete proposed work, and brainstorming technical solutions to client problems.
Other duties as assigned.
Performance of all job duties is intended to be completed under limited direct supervision of their supervisor.

Required Knowledge,Skills,& Abilities:
Required
Proficiency in performing data analytics, predictive analytics, machine learning, multivariate data analysis, and data mining as it relates to scientific data
Software programming/scripting proficiency in R, Python, Java, and/or MATLAB
Experience and proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, and Powerpoint
Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving abilities are required
Ability to lead group of co-workers in execution of a task
Working knowledge of statistics, experimental error, and quantification as it applies to scientific data
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences
Competent in using Linux/Unix operating system command line interface
Ability to work independently and to interact effectively with individuals on multi-disciplinary teams
Team player with a positive attitude

Preferred
Experience in analytical chemistry or biochemistry including chromatography, mass spectrometry, spectroscopy, hyperspectral imaging, proteomics, metabolomics, RF signal processing, genomics, or other biochemical analysis methods
Experience in developing proteomics or metabolomics data analysis pipelines
Experience with NextFlow, SnakeMake, or similar workflow/pipeline management systems
Experience in developing natural language processing (NLP) and/or machine vision models
Previous research and development experience related to chemical, biological, radiological, nuclear, and/or explosive (CBRNE) threats
Working knowledge of good software development practices such as version control systems (e.g., Git) and Agile development (e.g., workflows, sprints)
Ability to develop and query relational databases (MySQL or similar)
Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud Platform, or Microsoft Azure cloud computing
Ability to think creatively, demonstrate curiosity, and lead research teams
Sufficient business knowledge to support marketing, and bids and proposal efforts

Education/Experience:
Successful candidate must have a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Chemistry, Biochemistry, Biology, or a related scientific discipline with at least 3-5 years of professional experience; or a Ph.D. or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Chemistry, Biochemistry, Biology, or a related scientific discipline. Successful candidate must have significant experience in software programming/scripting for scientific data analysis and machine learning modeling.

Clearance:
Candidate must be willing to seek and maintain government security clearance at the SECRET level following hire. Candidates with current DoD SECRET or other clearance will be given preference.

Working Conditions/Equipment:
Ability to sit for long periods of time at desk/computer.

At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives.
Job Description Summary: We are looking for a Data Scientist with exceptional problem-solving skills, strong business-oriented mindset, robust bias for action and deep intellectual curiosity to develop and deploy analytics and insight solutions to unlock potential commercial opportunities for PayPal, drive initiatives to optimize sales operations and partner on strategic projects with other stakeholders and teams. You will be a part of PayPal’s Global Analytics and Data Science organization, working alongside a team of solution-focused, results-driven, energetic and collaborative Data Scientists and Business Analysts to solve some of the most challenging analytical problems with significant and direct impact to PayPal’s growth and continued leadership in the payment space. You will serve as the analytical expert and trusted thought partner by working extremely closely with PayPal’s Global and Enterprise Account sales team. And you will be interacting with a wide range of cross-functional teams on a regular basis.
Job Description:
Design, develop, deploy and refine ML-driven analytics solutions to drive strategy and execution for the sales team, for example, by developing sophisticated machine learning models to identify, quantify, evaluate and prioritize potential commercial opportunities among existing PayPal merchants and target merchant acquisitions
Partner closely with other cross-functional teams to develop data products to improve sales operation efficiency, effectiveness and proactively address potential bottlenecks/operational frictions that inhibit sales motion, for example, by developing advanced predictive models to identify sales opportunities that are at risk of stagnating or falling through
Serve as the analytical partner on strategic, cross-functional projects and initiatives by bringing in data insights and analytical rigor to inform and influence decisions, design and define methodology to monitor progress, and quantify and track outcomes
Collaborate with other Data Scientists and Business Analysts on the team to evolve and enhance the suite of data products in-deployment, for example, by adding further sophistication and robustness to the existing revenue forecast framework by incorporating an expanded array of internal and external data signals

Job Description Summary
The Data Scientist is responsible for developing pipelines for data intake, preprocessing, organization, and labeling and will contribute to establishing methods/processes for validating product performance as part of iterative model improvement and ultimately, regulatory clearance.
Job Description
** This role will not sponsor for H1B or OPT right now **
Caption Health’s mission is to detect disease early – when there is the highest potential for impact – by leveraging artificial intelligence and ultrasound. Our breakthrough AI platform enables any healthcare professional to perform high-quality ultrasound exams for early disease detection, in convenient and lower-cost outpatient settings including patients’ homes. It was recognized as one of TIME’s 100 Best Inventions of 2021 and one of Fast Company’s Next Big Things in Health Tech. Through our work with health plans, providers, patients, and industry partners, we are transforming care, expanding access, and reducing costs.

Duties/Responsibilities:
Curate ultrasound datasets as input to machine learning model training pipelines by ingesting, organizing, labeling, and collating ultrasound image data and clinical metadata.
Design test datasets and pipelines to benchmark model performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to provide data specifications for clinical study design, manage receipt of data from clinical sites, and coordinate labeling efforts with medical experts.
Contribute to algorithm performance test plan design, implementation, and execution as part of regulatory review of machine learning products.
Perform data visualization and error analysis to better understand model predictions and failure modes as part of iterative model improvement.
Leverage existing machine learning models to better understand our datasets and accelerate data labeling processes.
Analyze and preprocess ultrasound data to extract meaningful features for downstream machine learning applications.
Stay up to date with the latest research and advancements in ultrasound and machine learning.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Required Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:
Solid, hands-on experience in Python, including scientific libraries like NumPy, SciPy, and pandas.
Knowledge of cloud-based data organization and machine learning pipeline implementation (e.g., GCP, AWS, Azure).
Experience or interest in machine learning libraries such as TensorFlow, Keras, and PyTorch.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Proficient with Microsoft 365 or similar software.
Education and Experience:
A bachelor’s degree (or higher) in a scientific or technical field, such as computer science, data science, electrical engineering, biomedical engineering, or related.
5-8 years of experience in the data science field, preferably working with healthcare related data.
Experience working with medical imaging data, e.g. DICOM.
Experience in contributing to submissions for a regulatory agency.

Under the responsibility of the Director of Strategic Planning, Technology, and Innovation, iMMAP Inc. is seeking a Data Scientist to join our Global Tech Team to gain insights from analyzing organization data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large datasets and gaining insights from applying data science models in a humanitarian context. They must have a proven ability to drive impact decision-making with data-based insights. They will also be able to work independently and as part of a team.
Important Notice
Please do apply to this position, only if you are available to commence the assignment at the latest, on 15 September 2023, if you are the selected candidate. This position is initially advertised until 31 December 2023 but is subject to be extended, based on good performance, until 31 December 2024.
The position is open until 18 August 2023 but iMMAP Inc. will proceed with interviewing suitable and available candidates on a rolling basis and could close the hiring process before the set date if a suitable and competent candidate is identified.
Please note that it is expected for the selected candidate to start, ideally, in his/her new functions by 15 September 2023 at the latest
Description of Duties
Data Projects design and delivery:
Assess iMMAP Inc. internal data systems and build integrations with relevant data sources
Identifying relevant data sources for business needs
Automate and improve efficiency on data analysis processes internal to iMMAP Inc. using scripts and algorithms custom designed
Design and build scalable data pipelines and data warehouses.
Mine and analyze data from organization databases to drive optimization and improvement of programme delivery and inform future strategies
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources, data gathering techniques. and data models
Building predictive models using advances statistical techniques including machine learning, deep learning, neural networks and other advanced methods
Creating integrations for geo-referenced data and geospatial analysis platforms

Skill Sharing and Learning:
Work closely with the MEAL officer to identify learning opportunities in Data Science and other data-related fields.
Develop internal and external courses in Data Analysis, statistical analysis, and other relevant fields.
Lead iMMAP Inc Data Science Community of Practice and relevant knowledge management
Research and pilot innovative technologies to drive organizational performance
Stay up-to-date on the latest trends in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence

Internal and external relations:
Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging organization data to drive decision making.
Collaborate with the Business Development team to identify opportunities for organizational growth
Work with iMMAP Inc. internal and external stakeholders to understand their needs and develop data-driven solutions
Participate in software and web development projects to ensure data interoperability across all platforms.
Collaborate effectively on Data projects with iMMAP Inc. personnel and partners Worldwide
Represent iMMAP in relevant scientific and academic discussions and fora.
Qualifications
A degree in data science, statistics, mathematics, physics, computer science or any proven experience doing data science in a humanitarian context is required.
3+ years of work experience in data science or similar field is required.
Very strong programming skills in Python is required.
Experience with machine learning and statistical analysis is desired.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Responsible for modeling complex healthcare inquiries, discovering insights, and identifying opportunities using statistical, algorithmic, data-mining, and visualization techniques. Integrate and analyze large, varied datasets and communicate the results of large-scale analytics.

Description

What You'll Do:
Support decision-making by building, maintaining, and improving multiple analytic systems collaboratively. Design experiments, test hypotheses, and build analytical models to explore, explain, and predict health-related outcomes. Model and frame meaningful healthcare scenarios that impact strategic direction throughout the healthcare business.
Work closely with clients, data stewards, project managers, and Information Systems teams to turn healthcare data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound organizational decisions. Collaborate with subject matter experts to select the relevant sources of information. Educate the organization from technical and business perspectives on advanced analytic approaches. Help the organization understand the principles and the computational analysis behind processes to ensure organizational support. Work with data stewards to ensure compliance with existing governance, regulatory, architecture, and security policies.
Apply statistical (descriptive, analytical, inferential) analysis and data mining techniques to generate real-world evidence and prediction systems for stand-alone projects or to be assimilated into production systems. Provide evidence that is congruent and reliable. Work iteratively to validate findings using experimental design, scenario modeling, and sensitivity analyses. Conduct data analyses that range from simple descriptive statistics to highly complex algorithms.
Develop innovative and effective approaches to solving analytics problems. Communicate results and methodologies with transparency. Identify, generate, and apply the appropriate algorithm to discover patterns. Come up with solutions to broadly defined business needs by leveraging pattern detection over complex datasets.
Present findings to the business leaders through presentations, dashboards, or other analytical output. Provide method validation with assumptions, strengths, and limitations in a way that stakeholders can easily understand. Recommend ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to more efficient processes.
To Qualify for This Position, You'll Need the Following:

Required Work Experience: Three years of relevant quantitative and qualitative analytics experience. Ph.D. training will be counted as three years of experience
Required Software and tools: Microsoft Office, SQL, Statistical programming tools (such as R, Python, or SAS)
Required Skills and Abilities:
Proficiency in using SQL to query large, complex datasets.
Strong programming, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Knowledge of statistical techniques, including statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, predictive analytics, and multivariate testing
Ability to innovate and collaborate
Team player who is proactive and detail-oriented
We Prefer That You Have The Following:
Experience with supervised and/or unsupervised machine learning
Experience with data management in relational data sources
Experience creating dashboards and visualizations with Tableau or PowerBI
Experience working with healthcare data
Experience with Value Based Care programs
Strong written, verbal, presentation, communication, and interpersonal skills

Life insurance
Paid annual leave — the longer you work here, the more you earn
Nine paid holidays
On-site cafeterias and fitness centers in significant locations
Wellness programs and a healthy lifestyle premium discount
Tuition assistance
Service Recognition

Position Title: Data Scientist
Reports To: Manager of Business Intelligence
Department: Business Intelligence
Status: Exempt
Position Purpose:
The Data Scientist role is responsible for leveraging statistical and computational methods to derive insights and develop predictive models based on company and industry data. This includes building algorithms to support internal departments, designing and implementing experiments, and analyzing sales and operational data to drive decision-making across the organization. Additionally, the Data Scientist will also be responsible for creating datasets and leveraging advanced statistical analysis, machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques to guide the company's strategic initiatives. Close collaboration with cross-functional teams will be necessary to address business challenges and opportunities while continuously enhancing models and algorithms to ensure accurate and effective results.
Essential Job Functions:
The Data Scientist must be able to perform all the following duties and responsibilities with or without a reasonable accommodation.
Developing scalable data analysis and machine learning models using tools like Python, R, SAS, BigQuery ML, Spark ML, Hadoop, and SQL.
Make custom data models, standard statistical models, machine learning or deep learning algorithms for building diagnostic, predictive, prescriptive, and automated data solutions
Designing experiments and conducting A/B testing to evaluate hypotheses and measure the impact of changes.
Support integration of solutions within existing business processes using automation techniques.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, claims, and manufacturing to drive business outcomes.
Communicate findings and recommendations to technical and non-technical staff through reports, dashboards, and presentations.
Working on multiple projects simultaneously, prioritizing tasks and managing timelines to deliver high-quality work.
Nature of Supervision:
This position does not have any supervisory responsibilities.
Education/Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science / Mathematics / Statistics or related field. Master’s degree preferred.
2-5 years of experience in solving problems requiring complex quantitative reasoning using data & modeling techniques.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with statistical programming tools such as Python, R, SAS, BigQuery ML, Spark ML, Hadoop, SQL, and/or others
Expertise in machine learning algorithms and techniques, including supervised and unsupervised learning, regression analysis, classification, clustering, and predictive analytics.
Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to develop and implement analytical solutions to complex business problems.
Research new theories and technologies in analytics to generate innovative ideas for practical models.
Knowledge and experience in ETL, relational databases, and data warehousing.
Comfortable working with both technical and non-technical staff to translate concepts and algorithms into working prototypes and solutions.

Job Title: Junior Consultant in Strategy & Data Science - New York
Job Description:
Ekimetrics is a leader in data science and AI-powered solutions. For over 16 years, we’ve pioneered the use of AI and advanced data science applied to unified marketing measurement, holistic business optimization and broad-ranging sustainability goals.
Our goal: combine high impact with long-term business purpose.
Ekimetrics is one of the world’s largest independent analytics firms with offices on 3 continents, and with more than 400 data experts. Since 2006, we have led more than a thousand data science projects in over 50 countries, generating more than $1bn in profit for our customers.
We help companies rethink the way they operate, so they can reconcile financial KPIs with non-financial goals. We are uniquely specialized in creating scalable data and analytics solutions that drive high-impact optimizations in alignment with overarching brand strategy and sustainability goals.
At Ekimetrics, we believe our best assets are our people. They are what set us apart and drive our success with entrepreneurial spirit and innovation. We encourage entrepreneurial spirit and innovation. We share what we know with others, and, above all, we love what we do. These sentiments are supported by our company values which serve as pillars in our work and attitude: curiosity, creativity, excellence, transmission, and pleasure.
In our New York office, we focus particularly in Marketing Science and the deployment of our ‘MMO’ offer (Marketing Mix Optimization), either through analytics as a service or building industrialized solutions.
As a Junior Consultant you will work with international blue-chip clients across diverse industries.
As both a data scientist and consultant, you will use and develop advanced data analytics and consulting skills on your projects.
From day one, you will join a team of three to six consultants and collaborate on one to two projects simultaneously.
You will have a hand in projects from discovery meetings to final recommendation; responsibilities include gathering and analyzing data, building statistical models, translating quantitative insights into strategic recommendations, and delivering the final results. The projects will push you to create innovative approaches as an owner and you’ll present your results directly to C-suite clients and business executives.
Our close-knit team will guide your growth to build expertise on best-practice methodologies and industry knowledge, working directly with Ekimetrics partners. Each member of our team takes a vested interest in the development of your technical skills and business acumen. Our team members continuously learn and grow through 70+ proprietary training sessions and collaboration with colleagues as coaches and mentors.

Finally, the opportunity to work for a growing, international pioneer in data science, will empower you to have an immediate impact by contributing to our passionate team.
Responsibilities:
1. Data Analysis and Model Construction
Utilize advanced statistical techniques and best data practices to help the team progress through project work
Develop a logical story combining data and industry knowledge to share actionable insights that will drive our clients' businesses
2. Strategic Partnerships with Clients
Liaise daily with clients to develop a deep understanding of their business context and experience
Deliver findings and battle plans with excellence and confidence
Provide ad-hoc analyses that further develop projects and client relationships by parameterizing the business questions
3. Ekimetrics Life
Support our fast growth by contributing to local and global initiatives such as Knowledge Management, Recruitment, Culture, Gender Balance and Diversity teams, Pioneering Machine Learning/AI techniques for the office, etc.
Qualifications:
We are looking for a talented, dual-profile consultant.
Data Skills
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Statistics, Economics, Engineering or other related field, or a data science bootcamp.
Outstanding record of academic achievement.
0-2 years of experience in Data Analysis / Modeling / Advanced Analytics
Passion for data, statistics or applied mathematics
Familiarity with modeling / optimization techniques
Completed projects using advanced analytical methodologies and/or statistics to answer business questions
Experience with statistical software such as R or Python (preferred).
Consulting Skills
Consulting experience or interest in working as a consultant
Strong interest in marketing & business issues
Exceptional written and oral communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a team setting
Self-driven and motivated to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Continuously striving for high performance
Spanish-speaking is a plus
What we offer:

At Ekimetrics, final base salary is determined by a multitude of factors and vary from candidate to candidate. Determining factors for base compensation include, but are not limited to, professional background, years of experience, and skillset. A reasonable estimate of the base salary for our NYC office is $60,000. In addition to this base salary, we have a comprehensive benefits package, generous bonus package, and a dynamic promotions and salary raise structure.

Data Science and Engineering
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service, with more than 238 million members in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume their entertainment on-demand, personalized to their interests, across a variety of screens.

Our multi-channel messaging experiences are the primary way we connect with consumers, delivering essential updates and building excitement for our product. The Messaging team at Netflix creates & delivers messaging experiences across the customer lifecycle to drive acquisition, retention & member engagement.

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to support the transformation of our messaging program to a platform that can serve the many needs of our diversifying product offering. This high-impact role will be pivotal in uncovering opportunities, influencing product decisions, and informing future directions. The ideal candidate will excel in experimentation, causal inference studies, and cross-functional collaboration and share a passion for continuously enabling more at-scale data science applications to improve the Netflix messaging program.
In this role, you will:
Be a strong thought partner that influences strategic decision-making through data-driven insights and recommendations
Understand where various opportunities fit into the broader strategies and prioritize competing demands to ensure the most impactful items
Proactively identify and perform data exploration to inform future product directions
Make data-driven recommendations for opportunities, prioritization, and resource allocation
Effectively identify and apply analytics, experimentation, and causal inference techniques for given business problems
Develop and validate the appropriate metrics to measure success in a given product area
Cultivate strong partnerships with cross-functional partners from product, engineering, design, consumer research, etc.
Present your research and insights to all levels of the company
You are:
Strong statistical knowledge and intuition - ideally utilized in experimentation and observational causal studies settings
Strong product knowledge and intuition - ideally utilized in consumer product development settings
Highly skilled in quantitative programming languages such as Python or R
Highly skilled in SQL, familiar with distributed data stores (S3, Presto, Hive, Spark)
Highly skilled in effectively engaging with diverse stakeholders and cultivating strong partnerships.
Passionate about driving and influencing product strategies in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment
Comfortable with ambiguity, capable of thriving with minimal oversight and process.
Plus: experienced in scaling experimentation practices by building the right frameworks and tooling
Plus: experienced in building causal inference solutions
Plus: experienced in building real-world machine learning models with demonstrated impact
Plus: familiar with software engineering practice and working with APIs

Role Description
